cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 235 mi E of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Turning WNW then NW, crossing the Yucatan Peninsula Saturday night and tracking north-westward across the south-central Gulf toward the north-west Gulf Coast (TX/LA) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-west Gulf Coast near the TX/LA border (west of Lake Charles – east of Galveston)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Honduras/Nicaragua border westward to Punta Castilla including the Bay Islands of Honduras
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeastern Honduras, Yucatan Peninsula, and the north-west Gulf Coast from Texas to Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤8%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; strongest gusts could reach 35–45 mph Tuesday if the center tracks close to Houston.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge of 1–3 ft above normal tides along the upper Texas coast is possible if the cyclone moves ashore just east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain late Monday through Tuesday could total 2–4 inches with locally higher amounts, causing ponding and minor flooding on‐dock and in access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None significant identified at this lead time
